snippet: The accord, valued at around $4 billion, guarantees German companies access to critical minerals in exchange for technological and other investments.
abstract: Germany and Kazakhstan agree to a strategic partnership that guarantees German companies the right to search for and mine rare earths and other raw materials in Kazakhstan in exchange for technological and other investments; accord is valued at about $4 billion.
lead_paragraph: The accord, valued at around $4 billion, guarantees German companies access to critical minerals in exchange for technological and other investments.

headline.main: Germany and Kazakhstan Sign Rare Earths Agreement
headline.print_headline: Kazakhstan Agrees to Give Germany Rights to Mine Rare Earth Minerals
